docs.snippet: TWO major inter-American music festivals are in the making. The first will be in Washington next April and the other in Caracas, Venezuela, in the spring of 1960. Both have been shifted from the dates originally planned.

docs.snippet: The liner Brazil, chronologically a dowager but still as trim and sprightly as many a younger ship, reached the end of the line yesterday.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 10--A spokesman for Secretary General Dag Hammarskjold defended today the suspension of Povl Bang-Jensen, a 48-year-old Dane, from his post of senior United Nations political affairs officer.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 13--The United Nations Special Committee on Hungary was expected to meet here within a few days to discuss the reported trial of Gen. Pal Maleter, former Defense Minister in Budapest.

docs.snippet: PASCAGOULA, Miss., Dec. 16 --The first major United States liner built for service to the east coast of South America in more than fifty years was launched here today.
